name: supererogatory
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
involving doing more than necessary: A supererogatory act is a good act that is in excess of what is morally or legally required. Medieval moralists recognized "supererogatory" acts, i.e. acts that are positively good but not required, such as joining a religious order.
More examplesFewer examplesTipping is (legally, though perhaps not morally) supererogatory: it is good to tip but not legally required.Houses signal they are participating in Halloween with a pumpkin lantern at the window, making police signs supererogatory.You may be tempted to resist calling such small actions supererogatory because they are not grand or heroic.
